author: Staff Reporter
text:
Prof. M.S. Swaminathan, Chairman, MSSRF (seated) presents an award to Geetha Sharma. Also seen are (from left) S.V. Sista, executive trustee, Population First, advocate Bader Sayeed, and A.L. Sharada, director, Population First —Photo: M. Vedhan

The seventh edition of Laadli Media and Advertising Awards for Gender Sensitivity 2014-15 (southern and western region) honoured media professionals from various organisations across the country, on Friday.

M.S. Swaminathan, Chairman, M.S. Swaminathan Research Foundation, recalling his experiences while he was involved in drafting population policy, said: “We realised how important it was to empower women and children. Gender sensitivity is a must for policies to be executed successfully. I congratulate the team of Population First and the journalists for bringing about sensitivity amongst masses.” A.L. Sharada, director, Population First spoke.

Lifetime award

The ‘Laadli Lifetime Achievement Award’ was presented to Vaasanthi for her contribution as a writer and journalist to Tamil literature.

A total of 52 winners were shortlisted from 1,200 entries. They were awarded for highlighting gender issues and concerns through their work in the print, web and electronic media, a note said.

Dennis S. Jesudasan, special correspondent, The Hindu , received the best news report award for his story on ‘Rape Mediation Order.’ Geetha Sharma received the best magazine feature on acid attacks in Meri Saheli . Special jury citations were also given to three journalists.
title: Laadli media awards presented
